document.title: Hospitality & Tourism Career Cluster Introduction to Culinary Arts

1D75E7247FBD4AF583F04E813D97DD7D.description: Explain concept of “sous vide” cooking method and current applications.

F6203ED7CFE74385B97DF38E626F433A.description: Demonstrate use and application of microwave cooking method.

6C53106EB8444F008ED45AFFD06045A4.description: Demonstrate basic combination cooking methods including stewing and braising.

C8E673D8E67C437FB34979C295D00352.description:
Demonstrate basic moist heat cooking methods including poaching, simmering, boiling,
and steaming.

F9C859FC2F134F0CB25882E3D6453D9C.description:
Demonstrate basic dry heat cooking methods including sauté, griddle, pan-fry, deep fry,
baking, roasting, and grilling.

44BE7032B64341C0BD567424F6C65AEB.description:
Identify basic food cooking methods such as dry heat, moist heat, and combination
cooking.

038BC19958C04CFCA965D00A66847A89.description:
Examine and practice cooking methods, techniques, and preparations such as dry
heat and moist heat methods.

EEDA05A936944051AABBAF40750728AD.description:
Conduct a survey to identify a variety of areas where waste control can be utilized in the
kitchen.

D0DC68C122714670BD7D2779FD1C028A.description: Research and present recycling and composting policies in your municipality.

C85429E272FC492B89901CB0C2C54A62.description: List products being used in your kitchen/lab that could be recycled.

AA0E8B23933D437498EFDFE12BAA2D51.description:
Identify environmentally friendly cleaning products that could be utilized in place of current
products used. Be sure to keep in mind comparable cost comparisons.

BBA45F6471A24A6481AE86C17DCCA608.description: Compare different types of composting and identify products appropriate for composting.

C5827C7165AE4D4698CDC9693C6DC47F.description:
Define sustainability, recyclable, reusable, energy efficient, “food miles”, carbon footprint,
and biodegradable.

7B7DAE8B457D4A8EA9D430FED1935726.description:
Identify and become aware of the many aspects related to sustainability of our
resources and the economic aspect to foster awareness of sustainability issues
impacting the culinary industry.

02AE0585E6D941A3B51E498689F09034.description: Identify and demonstrate proficiency for various napkin folds.

831751E7E77B4F6E86BA2C9912E427A6.description:
Identify and explain formal dining etiquette from both service and customer perspectives
and be able to demonstrate both.

479AE2D69AB94BDBA3FDC0A0575A5122.description:
Demonstrate the general rules of table setting and service, and identify the types of
flatware, china, hollowware, and glassware and explain the specific uses of each.

AF033341485C41D3893DBCB4F9FC5FCB.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of guest service and customer relations including handling
of difficult situations and accommodations for the disabled.

B6407650EF4C4211B90FDDF0D8450C29.description:
Identify and use proper techniques for greeting, seating, and presenting the menu to
customers, and dramatize ways of describing and recommending menu items to guests.

DEDABAF5EF1D4DA8A47F1C2BA52C25AE.description:
Describe the traditional service staff for a restaurant and for catered events, and list the
duties and responsibilities of each.

6BC7996E99C14FAB813BC67B5A3BA349.description:
Identify and apply front of the house techniques and methods of operation used in
restaurants and catering services.

F8FC8122AC3E425CB290426C2D957158.description:
Discuss the proper professional respect given to food service administrators, managers
and/or chefs through effective interaction and communication. Emphasize positive
attitude, initiative, and motivation as well as appropriate responses.

7722557DC66E4938AE2CAE43435F7848.description:
Identify the difference between personal and professional communication, and include
caveats for social networks, emails, and texting.

C1DFD430A91342B09CC7E3721FB8D3CF.description:
Define professionalism and professional appearance as it has developed throughout the
history of uniforms: include presentation and functionality.

A275764FF0D549D99CFCBDBE70E427A0.description:
Define and demonstrate appropriate work ethics: attitude, appearance, attendance,
teamwork, character, productivity, organizational skills, communication, and respect.

CE89E4AE856D43A9BBB03409B1ED2E5C.description: Write a personalized resume and a personal letter of recommendation.

BF41347491534B1B98B4EC0B6A971DDB.description:
Discuss and practice sound human relations and professionalism concepts for a career
pathway in Culinary Arts employment.

ABB5C9544CFF4229AEA1F317D5734247.description:
Identify types of flours, sugars and other ingredients commonly used in a bake shop and
their proper handling/storage procedures.

966777C2DECE47D79CC73791FCE767AD.description:
Identify and distinguish between herbs, spices, oils, vinegars, seasonings, and their uses
and proper handling/storage procedures.

8D9B0BDFBF8D4005A951D0D09957CDBA.description:
Identify types of grains, legumes, and milled products and proper handling/storage
procedures.

7D7D68A014CF44878015E0A47C3389DB.description: Identify types of fruits and vegetables and proper handling/storage procedures.

F3AC8B97C8D240388AE801E46CA3E6B4.description:
Identify proteins such as poultry, beef, pork, seafood, and dairy, and examine the
potential contaminants associated with and proper handling/storage procedures.

425F379D1CCA482BB9AB629A46E8968D.description:
Identify various food products used in a commercial foodservice operation and list the
proper handling and storage procedures for each.

69C990240DB34261A6966D70829B0C90.description:
Identify menu requirements for various diets such as vegan, vegetarian, low sodium, and
low calorie.

775F3BF4EEAF4FB88725CBC157260755.description:
Identify and examine the various food allergies to include gluten, nuts, dairy products, and
shellfish, and ways a food service operation must address these allergies.

99C3139117754192B7BD071CB5FB2BB9.description:
Examine current trends and issues in food and nutrition, fad diets, proper weight loss
techniques, and how these fit into healthy menu options.

A623D838D0DB4FADBC8170E5044AB6B2.description:
Define a serving size, portion control, recommended serving size, and balanced diet while
maintaining a correct nutritional intake.

440033E19314452EB6568FCD06318E04.description:
Examine the six major food groups, nutrient contributions of vitamins, minerals, and
nutrient variability within a group and daily recommended intake.

84D186753EC44228AB2487F1F62C9A11.description:
Discuss and develop knowledge of the importance of USDA Nutritional Guidelines such
as “MY PLATE” and examine how these guidelines can be misleading and complex due
to cultural constraints, eating disorders, and food allergies.

E60615B1EE024E5BB582BCF69CE5736E.description:
Examine the principles of nutrition including the six major classes of nutrients,
proteins, and carbohydrates: simple, complex, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water.

0A0B9C7E317C482D8F72C09D0EC04DED.description:
Perform proper knife techniques for cuts such as julienne, batonnet, small, medium, and
large dice using potatoes, carrots, and other vegetables.

B976DD873C3241D6A39743DC27F7C7FE.description: Demonstrate proper knife safety, cleaning, and storage.

96ED66D4A6824F60BE15DFADF89A17DB.description: Define and demonstrate the concept of “mise en place” in setting up a cutting work station.

15E8EB85D31048449D75C2E17ED1218B.description: Identify and practice proper knife safety procedures and rules.

B56FAA601DE2446590186F2FE3B2B0D1.description: Identify the different types of knives, their use, parts, and components.

26F053CBEEBF4792AC32B3E2EAC8185F.description: Examine and perform all aspects of kitchen knife use and classic knife skills.

1C6742FA0DD940A294B078CB3CE18B95.description: Follow the written directions to prepare the recipe used above.

64E3A8842EFC4F42A217FC8DD208ED88.description:
Demonstrate the concept of recipe conversions by identifying and converting recipe
formulas to increase or decrease yields.

5847108BF5194ED8A50DD9CCD988B5D1.description:
Identify procedures used to calculate the cost of a standardized recipe and cost per
portion and perform calculations.

0EF7CE20D061440894080997833EE157.description:
Demonstrate proper use of a spring and balance scales using both US measures and
metric measures.

28133457C9B045C9AF5292AE366F9EA9.description:
Identify and master the use of different types of measuring tools including dry and liquid
measuring cups, measuring spoons, portioning tools, and digital and electronic scales.

770108E4CBDC42A9B1B9E569A7FC9E26.description:
Demonstrate the concept of recipe “mise en place” by identifying and assembling
ingredients and equipment for a specific recipe.

63163456453D4495A23A8556E358F801.description:
Identify recipe terminology including measurement abbreviations, instructions, and
directions.

B86C8A6C55464F4FABA05A4DFC914179.description:
Define standardized recipe, the components of the recipe, and explain the reasons for
use in commercial kitchens.

30A8995D56214824BA6CFCED1DEB8234.description:
Examine and identify standardized recipes and their role in a commercial kitchen.
Practice culinary math skills through recipe conversion and measurements.

4EC2E7ED4AC14A16A3F308D10B3C40C3.description:
Examine and identify a Material Safety Data Sheet and explain their importance when
handling common foodservice chemicals. Display manual of all MSDS for each chemical
used in the kitchen, dining room, and dish room.

A497F1E2C56547C29B59C141AD5C936F.description:
Identify gas safety issues for gas ranges and ovens, including shut off valves and pilot
lights.

168EF1F6490947B697CAC803BB63FC70.description:
Practice and examine kitchen safety in the areas of falls, strains, sprains, and lifting using
proper techniques.

8D5B8BBD3C464A04B6C829BBC1751583.description:
Examine and practice correct Fire Safety procedures using correct classifications of fire
extinguishers, hood suppression systems, and emergency evacuation routes.

65E2A908A8274B3F8520B7A2B395E558.description:
Discuss principals of basic First Aid treatments for a foodservice environment including
basic cuts, lacerations, abrasions, punctures, CPR, food allergies, anaphylactic shock,
Heimlich maneuver, and minor burns.

1DFAD5F20B4B4AD3BE96E06A8F546A34.description:
Analyze and examine fundamental safety skills and practices related to the
commercial kitchen.

65A8D9A65C3E46FDA1C430340392C88F.description:
Develop an equipment checklist documenting each student’s proficiency in use of various
equipment and small wares used in a commercial kitchen or bake shop.

E951321CC2484275BC4E987D6AF8D66B.description: Discuss and practice cleanliness of kitchen equipment and facilities.

CA95025B19684BEEB45A3BC34764EC74.description:
Identify and distinguish between the various mixers and small wares, demonstrating
proper use and cleaning.

5444EE5302324A06B9E9A30C7341157C.description:
Identify and distinguish between a standard and convection oven, stoves, ranges,
steamers, fryers, refrigerators, freezers, slicers, food processors, coffee and tea brewing
equipment, and food storage equipment. Demonstrate proper use and cleaning of each.

09ED0B2828314B75A7E6D7F737BBD536.description:
List and describe the tools used for commercial food preparation, cooking, baking, and
serving, and demonstrate proper use of each.

9CE5CF30E2A24B7194202D442480E268.description:
Name and describe various fixed equipment and small wares associated with the
commercial kitchen and bake shop.

32F8D92C7084415EB10E9C09DF6E49EB.description: Identify, calibrate and properly use thermometers.

C098DB2222664E5D8C886E2B09E71A60.description: Discuss and practice the proper use of gloves in food handling.

F48B605F10E143CABD5EB7DF5B72FAFB.description:
List and demonstrate food handling, preparation, and storage techniques that prevent
cross-contamination between raw and ready-to-eat foods and between animal and
seafood, including sources of other potentially hazardous food products.

9A6730DAEC314090867E29C74B8B5570.description:
Identify the factors that affect the growth of food borne pathogens (i.e. FATTOM) and
explain how time and temperature guidelines can reduce growth of microorganisms.

9BA6657CB0524C74B14D1E252227F9B6.description: Discuss and practice proper labeling of stored foods.

92A7947DF2964FBAAF9B28F29B2B9B3B.description:
Identify and demonstrate proper receiving and storage principles such as FIFO, rotating
inventory, and storage/receiving temperatures.

DC429A906A6F417DBAB3AFD759147B70.description:
Discuss Health Department inspections and facility requirements of commercial
foodservice establishments. Students conduct a mock Health Department inspection of
the kitchen lab.

F7B7B39340684EBD923E23B0C2CF1740.description: Discuss pest control and management of infestations.

360B780D28564B6A89AEF9E1D577E209.description:
Demonstrate the proper use and cleaning of an automatic dishwasher (if available) and
identify the chemicals used for dishwasher cleaning.

DD3B05610DFA49A7B3E4DDE9D3252FF9.description:
Identify and demonstrate proper pot and pan washing with four-compartment sinks and
the use of sanitizers and detergent chemicals.

82A3FEA738C146C292ECF1D74323C431.description:
Practice proper contaminant prevention measures as it relates to food preparation in the
commercial kitchen.

227D021F4E79484EA4878437BF4B77AD.description: Identify the biological, physical, and chemical contaminants, and prevention measures.

C10DA2E107184C15A8BF2A189EDF0E73.description: Identify personal hygiene policies and hand washing procedures.

38367F6B03B04FB89A890E02631C3C31.description:
Demonstrate and practice correct sanitation as it relates to healthy living and the
modern commercial kitchen and bake shop.

73CBC075C83C422194DB9E0D84B34242.description:
Identify the positions of the classical and modern “kitchen brigade” and outline the
organizational structure of various food service and hospitality organizations.

FAD89683DE2B44A28B41B54CE98FD375.description:
List and describe the various cuisines and their relationships to history and cultural
development.

F0C6EA20E22D4FD5B7823887F5298B74.description:
Identify key historical persons and summarize their contributions to the evolution and
development of modern day foodservice, to include but not limited to, Carême, Escoffier,
and Catherine De Medici.

DC2AE3323B02489ABA1DA873267F249E.description:
Explore career opportunities and pathways in the foodservice industry and identify
specific jobs and positions such as, but not limited to: Chef, Dietician, Food Stylist, Food
Demonstrators, Research and Development Workers, Food Service Workers, Nutritionist,
Food Service Manager, and Health Inspector.

5B245BE8728A47DA884C1F0940588A83.description:
Name and define professional organizations such as the American Culinary Federation,
(ACF), National Restaurant Association (NRA), Professional Chef’s Association (PCA),
Research Chef Association (RCA), and United States Chef’s Association (USCA), and the
importance and benefits of membership.

47FBA8670A544BB38A54DD740BE5BBD0.description: Describe and define professionalism in the various roles of the food service organization.

66D70ACAC79F4BA9B0568FFE9E3BBC61.description: Examine and identify the history and philosophy of the food service industry.

C0858EF4525C4CC482316B2FB325B93A.description:
Create a personal leadership plan to participate in programs, conferences, community
service, and competitive events on the local, state, and national level that align with the
competencies, skills, and knowledge of this course.

7C2BD9BF982D45D68294CA28A3EE499E.description:
Explain how participation in FCCLA can promote lifelong responsibility for community
service, professional growth, and development.

67CF5A30D0DD466CAF1ED2924A9F80EF.description:
Discuss the mission, purpose, motto, colors, official dress, and other distinguishing
characteristics of FCCLA.

DB90312A9F07484299CB3F5B25C93618.description:
Examine how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology
education courses through leadership development, school and community service
projects, and competitive events.

1A621555039F41D5905A49C6CDC0844E.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

7ADD4DF84FE74C1AB5C8DAB21EF8F39A.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace
to be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

0187892D1301462BB2098DFE16C95489.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

D616C83C506345C1B1A99FF231F0C7D6.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

376BBCEF9927471FA0C69DBCEB0C3C4E.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

AB4FB7F5D8354793AAE4652032F8212C.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

0A854E8F9D2B4747918CC2C642253FAD.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
